item.title: The Art of Being a Coauthor
item.description: The Art of Being a Coauthor So You Have Been Invited to Be a Coauthor‚ÄîCongratulations! Most likely, even before contributing to the writing, you‚Äôve already played a significant role, perhaps by providing key data, technical expertise, or essential resources. This is a rewarding moment, as it signifies that your contribution is recognized and valued. However, with this recognition comes a responsibility to support the progress of the paper or proposal. In reality, most of the writing and heavy lifting is carried out by one or two lead authors, who are often PhD students or postdocs.

Earth and Space Science Open Archive, DOI: 10.22541/au.172591515.59105520/v2, 2024. üìÑ Enhancing RBF-FD efficiency for highly non-uniform nodes distributions via adaptivity S Li, Leevan Ling, Xin Liu, Pankaj K Mishra, Mrinal K Sen, and J Zhang. Numerical Mathematics: Theory, Methods and Applications 17, 310-330 - 2024

item.title: Research
item.description: ‚ú® MULTIVERSE - Multiphysics inversion and uncertainty estimation (2024 - 2026) Your browser does not support the video tag. MULTIVERSE is a project that will develop methods and technologies for stochastic multiphysics inversion and uncertainty estimation for geophysical data, leveraging modern high-performance computing (HPC) and scientific machine learning (SciML). The project aims to revolutionize the resolution of geophysical challenges by advancing data extraction techniques. By integrating physics-based knowledge into machine learning, MULTIVERSE reduces reliance on large datasets and enables fast, reliable predictions for parameter inference, uncertainty estimation, and data integration, even with limited, noisy, and multiscale geophysical data.
